title.value: Revisiting Transfer Functions: Learning About a Lagged Exposure-Outcome Association in Time-Series Data
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned in the citation of the paper.
title.quote:
Mamiya H, Schmidt AM, Moodie EEM and Buckeridge DL (2022) Revisiting
Transfer Functions: Learning About a Lagged Exposure-Outcome
Association in Time-Series Data.

extractions.description: This paper describes the use of transfer functions to estimate lagged exposure-outcome associations in time-series data without needing a pre-specified lag length. It uses a case study involving sugar-sweetened drinkable yogurt sales to illustrate the method.

type.justification: The paper provides empirical analysis using a case study involving real-world data from sugar-sweetened drinkable yogurt sales to illustrate transfer functions in time-series models.
type.quote: We provide a case study to capture the time-lagged association between weekly purchasing outcome of sugar-sweetened drinkable yogurt and weekly-varying display promotion of these beverages.

name.justification: The paper is focused on time-series analysis through the lens of transfer functions to model lagged exposure-outcome associations.
name.quote: Time-lagged exposure-outcome associations are of critical interest in time-series analysis.

name.justification: The research is situated within the epidemiology field, particularly concerning environmental exposure and health outcomes over time.
name.quote: Environmental exposures often show a time-lagged association with outcomes.

name.justification: The paper applies Bayesian frameworks to fit dynamic linear models in their case study.
name.quote: The model was fit under the Bayesian framework as described in Supplementary Appendix S4.

name.justification: Dynamic linear models are specifically mentioned as part of the time-series regression used in the study.
name.quote: The time-series regression used in this study is a dynamic linear model.

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not propose a novel model but rather applies existing models to illustrate the use of transfer functions.
is_contributed.quote: The time-series regression used in this study is a dynamic linear model [21, 22].

is_executed.justification: There is no mention of execution on GPU or CPU as the focus is on the statistical model application.
is_executed.quote: The model was fit under the Bayesian framework as described in Supplementary Appendix S4.

is_compared.justification: There is no direct numerical comparison of models, rather the study emphasizes model fitting and application.
is_compared.quote: When competing shapes show similar model fit.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides foundational information on dynamic linear models and Bayesian applications.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The time-series regression used in this study is a dynamic linear model [21, 22].

name.justification: The dataset was used as part of a case study to analyze a lagged exposure-outcome association in time-series data.
name.quote: The model was fit under the Bayesian framework as described in Supplementary Appendix S4.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper provided for the dataset, as it seems to be collected for the purposes of this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Data analysis and drafting of the manuscript was led by HM.
